A version of '''[[Indev 0.31]]''' was released on '''February 5, 2010''', at 15:58 UTC.<ref>[[wordofnotch:372480972|You can now change the difficulty from the options screen]] – The Word of Notch, February 5, 2010</ref>

== Additions ==
=== Mobs ===
'''[[File:Zombie JE1.png|120px]] [[Giant]]s'''
* Oversized [[zombie]]s.
* Can walk up to the [[player]].
* [[Hostile]] mob.
** Can only attack the player if the player is standing on top of it.

=== General ===
'''[[Difficulty]]'''
* New settings.
** Peaceful, Easy, Normal, and Hard.

'''[[Inventory]] screen'''
* Right-clicking a stack cuts the stack in half.<ref name="Forum">{{link|url=https://www.minecraftforum.net/forums/archive/alpha/alpha-survival-single-player/796702-a-subtle-nuance-of-the-recent-update-involves|title=Right clicking now picks up half of the amount of blocks that you clicked on. Ex: right click on 64 wood blocks, pick up 32 of them.|author=Cheeze|website=Minecraft Forum|date=February 5, 2010}}</ref>
* It is now possible to continually craft more of an item, without having to put it in the inventory, if there are materials left in the [[crafting table]].<ref name="Forum2">{{link|url=https://www.minecraftforum.net/forums/archive/alpha/alpha-survival-single-player/796702-a-subtle-nuance-of-the-recent-update-involves|title=And when crafting,you can just clic multiple times the "result" box and the item will stack.|author=Perle|website=Minecraft Forum|date=February 6, 2010}}</ref>
* Changed block shading for a fourth time during Indev.
* The player model is now shown in the inventory GUI.

== Technical ==
'''Performance'''
* Performance improvements.

== Bugs ==
'''2 bugs reported'''
* [[Pig]]s and [[sheep]] now walk backwards and glide around.<ref>{{ytl|RRUoo_Nqc-g|Minecraft - Crazy walking animals bug|betasword|February 5, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{ytl|G5dHH1GpAi4|/Indev/ Sheep is on drugs.|LegacyMinecraft|February 6, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{ytl|q6B5JQG2R5g|Pigs on drugs|LegacyMinecraft|February 6, 2010}}</ref>
* Performance drops sometimes still occur in the game; this will not be fixed until [[Java Edition Indev 20100206-2034|20100206-2034]].
